BuffAvatarList.Desc: <color=#f39001>After the above characters join your party, Max HP, ATK, and DEF are increased by 20%.</color>

3.Title: Emperor of Fire and Iron
3.Desc: An Armored Crablord that has survived for countless eons and surpassed almost all other Fontemer Aberrants. The <color=#f39001>twin molten horns</color> located high up on its body are <color=#f39001>Pyro-aligned</color> organs that can unleash more vicious elemental attacks and grant it even stronger defensive capabilities. When the Armored Crablord unleashes certain attacks, its twin molten horns are <color=#f39001>closer to the ground</color>. This provides a great opportunity to use <color=#f39001>Elemental Reactions</color> to remove the Pyro element within.

6.Title: Experimental Field Generator
6.Desc: A large and out-of-control Fontaine Research Institute of Kinetic Energy Engineering device. During combat, it will channel ousia energy to unleash a Gravity Reduction Field. Characters within this field can jump significantly higher. When the device is in this state, its Gravity Reduction Field will shut down if its core is annihilated by <color=#f39001>Pneuma attacks</color>.

3.Title: Emperor of Fire and Iron
3.Desc: An Armored Crablord that has survived for countless eons and surpassed almost all other Fontemer Aberrants. The <color=#f39001>twin molten horns</color> located high up on its body are <color=#f39001>Pyro-aligned</color> organs that can unleash more vicious elemental attacks and grant it even stronger defensive capabilities. When the Armored Crablord unleashes certain attacks, its twin molten horns are <color=#f39001>closer to the ground</color>. This provides a great opportunity to use <color=#f39001>Elemental Reactions</color> to remove the Pyro element within.

6.Title: Goldflame Qucusaur Tyrant
6.Desc: A Qucusaurus whose extraordinary form is a result of being unable to withstand the great power it has been granted. It will fly into the air during combat and enter the "Golden Flame" energy-gathering form, creating a Ward around itself and launching a Flamewind Feather towards the ground that summons a flamewind. If you cannot destroy the Flamewind Feather before the Qucusaurus dives down into it, the creature will use a Phlogiston Current to return to the skies. This will persist until it is exhausted and returns to its original form. It seems, then, that <color=#f39001>destroying the Flamewind Feather using Elements that react with Pyro</color> may be the key to victory...

8.Title: Setekh Wenut
8.Desc: An apex predator deep in the desert that can use the power of Anemo to a certain extent, which allows it to leave the ground when in combat and enter a floating state. While floating, it can fire Windbite Bullets. If these bullets are not destroyed in time, they will be converted into a high-density curtain of such bullets. <color=#f39001>Attacks from elements that may react with Anemo</color> can destroy Windbite Bullets, which will temporarily decrease the corresponding Elemental RES of the Setekh Wenut. After 2 Windbite Bullets are destroyed in succession, the Setekh Wenut will be brought down from its floating state.
